message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.MM, cs.HC 

The paper deals with recognizing and localizing short temporal signals in image time series, which is a problem in computer vision. The proposed method involves encoding human motion in video sequences, which is a task related to computer vision and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves learning with a ConvNet, which falls under the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). The task of recognizing and localizing signed gestures in British Sign Language (BSL) videos involves natural language processing, which is related to the sub-category cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also involves multimedia analysis, which falls under the sub-category cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper deals with recognizing and localizing human motion, which is related to the sub-category cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction).
